snippet: Members of the Oglala Sioux tribe say that uncertainties from the 1970s “reign of terror” have left many peoples lives in limbo.
abstract: Oglala Sioux tribe demands that the federal government reopen dozens of cases related to the Wounded Knee standoff with federal troops in 1973, saying cases were mishandled by the FBI; tribal leaders say as many as 75 people were killed on the Pine Ridge reservation during a three-year period of internecine violence that followed the 71-day standoff; federal government has so far declined to re-examine the cases.
lead_paragraph: Members of the Oglala Sioux tribe say that uncertainties from the 1970s “reign of terror” have left many peoples lives in limbo.

headline.seo: Sioux Group Asks Officials to Reopen ’70s Cases
headline.main: Tribe Seeks Reopening of Inquiries in ’70s Deaths
headline.print_headline: Tribe Seeks Reopening Of Inquiries In ’70s Deaths
